page.title: 04PEOPLE AND HOUSING
page.content: There are 269 people living in the area at present.There are 56 children of school age and under.The children that go to school go to Orton C of E Primary school, which is situated in the village, or to Kirkby Stephen Grammar School which is 15 miles away. They are 46 retired people and 105 people who are working. People travel to work by car, van or wagon. A few people live in farm houses. All the houses in the area are built of stone with roughcast on them.There are many more old houses than new houses.The old houses have slate roofs but the new ones have tiles on them.Almost all the houses have gardens or a little yard.In the centre of the village the houses are built very close together. This was done as a form of self protection against the Scottish border raiders.
